pullRequest.title: Get generated keys only if supported by JDBC
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose
Prevent requesting generated keys from unsupported JDBC drivers.
Fixes #20673
Approach
Getting generated keys from JDBC driver only if supported by JDBC
driver. This prevents exceptions for statements issued against HANA DB like databases where JDBC driver does not support returning generated keys.
Remarks
Better to allow the user in the future to query whether the user expects to retrieve generated keys or not.
Suggested Labels
Area/StandardLibs
Component/Data
Type/Bug
Check List

 Read the Contributing Guide
 Updated Change Log
 Checked Tooling Support (#)
 Added necessary tests

 Unit Tests
 Spec Conformance Tests
 Integration Tests
 Ballerina By Example Tests

 API documentation

 Ballerina By Examples

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * Oracle support INSERT only but does not throw expection on others
          
          
            
                 * Oracle support INSERT only but does not throw exception on others

Is there a possibility to remove the Check for Oracle and MSSQL server check below? As per the comment The name of the database is being checked because there is no way to identify through the API. it seems it was done without knowing the Connection.getMetaData().supportsGetGeneratedKeys() API method.

commit.message:
Get generated keys JDBC only if supported

Getting generated keys from JDBC driver only if supported by JDBC
driver. This prevent exceptions for create/update queries issued
againsed HANA DB like databases where JDBC driver does not
support returning generated keys

Signed-off-by: KRVPerera <rukshan.viduranga@gmail.com>
